thread.title: Germany 1-0 England PLAYER RATINGS as Lukas Podolski makes Three Lions pay for missed chances
thread.title_full: Germany 1-0 England PLAYER RATINGS as Lukas Podolski makes Three Lions pay for missed chances

author: John Cross
title: Germany 1-0 England PLAYER RATINGS as Lukas Podolski makes Three Lions pay for missed chances
text:
Dele Alli looks dejected after a missed chance (Photo: REUTERS) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Lukas Podolski resigned England to defeat in Dortmund as the Three Lions were made to pay for missed chances. 
The Germany striker rifled home a thunderous second half effort as he bowed out of international football exactly how he would have dreamt it. 
Gareth Southgate will be disappointed not to get anything out of the game after a string of clear-cut misses in the opening 45 minutes. 
Adam Lallana struck the post, while Dele Alli missed a one-on-one as England dominated proceedings. 
Here is how our man John Cross rated the performances in Dortmund... Lukas Podolski celebrates scoring the decisive goal on his big day (Photo: REUTERS) It was one of Podolski's final acts in international football (Photo: REUTERS) Germany 
Germany’s No.2 but still a superb keeper. Busier than Hart, good saves. 
Kimmich 6 
Got exposed down his flank, especially with Sane offering little protection. 
Rudiger 6 
Roma defender who has been watched by Chelsea and Man City 
Hummels 6 
Didn’t relish Vardy’s pace or runs which stretched him. Solid though. Hummels challenges Vardy for the ball (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
Hector 6 
Tried to get forward, but little chance to overlap. Solid defensively. 
Kroos 7 
Normally runs the entire shooting match, still supplied nice pass for Podolski. 
Weigl 6 
High on a few Premier League wish lists, solid enough, but didn’t catch the eye. 
Sane 6 
The Man City wideman was well taken care of by both England full backs. Sane challenges Bertrand for the ball (Photo: Lars Baron) 
Podolski 7 
It felt like Podolski’s testimonial, and what a goal to remember it by. 
Brandt 5 
Offered very little, slashed one chance wide, subbed early. Poor. 
Werner 6 
Enjoying prolific season for RB Leipzig, did not really grasp his chance. 
Substitutes 
Schurrle, for Brandt, 59 mins, 6 
Can, for Wiegl, 66 mins, 6 
Muller, for Werner, 77 mins 
Rudy, for Podolski, 84 mins Podolski scored on his farewell match (Photo: Lars Baron) England 
Had quieter night of the two keepers. Note to Pep: played out from the back. 
Walker 7 
Plenty of energy and forward runs down the right flank. Excellent. 
Keane 7 
What a place to make your debut and looked comfortable in his surroundings. Michael Keane and Julian Brandt battle for the ball (Photo: PA Wire) 
Smalling 7 
Enjoyed being the kingpin in the middle, great pace and tenacity. 
Cahill 7 
Wore the armband with pride, looks so comfortable in a back three. 
Bertrand 7 
Looked composed and solid, put a strong case in Rose’s absence. 
Dier 7 
Went close with a header and a free kick. Bossed midfield very nicely. Dier played in a slightly more attacking role for England (Photo: Michael Regan - The FA) 
Livermore 7 
His first start for England and was not intimidated, strong and composed. 
Alli 8 MOTM 
England’s best player, has the makings of a world class talent. Superb. 
Lallana 7 
Fabulous run and shot in the first half deserved a goal, but hit the post. Lallana hit the post for England early in the game (Photo: Bongarts/Getty Images) 
Vardy 6 
Lucky not to be booked for an early dive. Worked and pressed hard. 
Substitutes 
Redmond, for Lallana, 66 mins, 6 
Rashford, for Vardy, 70 mins, 6 
Lingard, for Alli, 72 mins, 6 
Ward-Prowse, for Livermore, 83 mins 
Shaw, for Bertrand, 83 mins Like us on Facebook
